entry.title: Issue with Destination Visibility in Cloud Identity Services – Connectivity Plan Required or Workaro
entry.content:
We are currently facing an issue when attempting to create a Source System in the Identity Provisioning Service. Specifically, the destination we've configured in our SAP BTP subaccount isn't appearing as an option in Cloud Identity Services. Based on our research, it seems we may need to create a Cloud Identity Services Connectivity Plan within the same subaccount, as suggested by this community thread: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/no-destination-available-at-identity-provisioning-service/qaq-p/12609309.

We have been following this comprehensive guide to enable Joule capabilities for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/joule-for-sap-s-4hana-cloud-private-edition-a-comprehensive-setup-guide/ba-p/13786453.

However, we encountered an error while trying to create this Connectivity Plan, matching the scenario described in SAP Knowledge Base Article 3462424: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3462424.

Could the absence of this Connectivity Plan indeed be the root cause of our issue, or is there an alternative workaround available that would allow the already-created BTP destination to appear within the Cloud Identity Services? Any insights or guidance from the community would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: What's the future of SAP technical consultant?
entry.content:
With the introduction of next-generation technologies like SAP BTP, ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), SAP Build (LCNC tools), and SAP Joule (AI), it's clear that SAP is moving towards a clean core, cloud-based future.

However, in reality, many organizations are still operating on legacy ABAP systems, and real-world adoption of these new tools remains limited. With the end of ECC support by 2027, this gap raises some concerns.

❓Key Questions:

1. What is the realistic future for SAP technical consultants in this evolving landscape?

2. Is it practical to invest time in RAP, BTP, or AI tools, given the current slow adoption?

3. Are any real projects or clients actively implementing these technologies?

Would appreciate insights from those currently working on RAP or BTP-based projects or involved in modern SAP implementations.

Thank you!

entry.title: Unable to Access External Services from SAP Build Code-Based Fiori App
entry.content:
I have developed a Fiori application using SAP Build Code which primarily handles the frontend. The application is deployed in my SAP BTP subaccount and is functioning correctly from the UI perspective.

However, when attempting to integrate external services—specifically backend services that are already deployed in the same BTP subaccount—those services are not visible or accessible in the application. I have confirmed that:

 

  • The backend services are successfully deployed and running.

  • The destinations are configured correctly in BTP Cockpit.

entry.title: SAP Signavio Process Intelligence + Joule ( or other AI Agent) + Process Manager DMN ?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,
I have the following scenario in mind and would like your opinions on the possibility of implementing it.
A company has S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition 2024 with a transaction Z (clean core was not used) with numerous business rules. This transaction actually calls several tables (25 in total), where each table has business rules defined. These are regulatory rules from the country's energy agency.
These rules relate to master data of cost collectors as well as transactional data. (Ex.: a certain invoice or goods receipt was incorrectly posted with material X because it has rules in its master data that prevented it from being assigned to cost collector Y—also due to rules in its master data).
Assuming I have already mapped a material consumption process to these cost collectors in Signavio Process Manager, I can also assume I have created DMN (decision model and notation) rules that include the rules of transaction Z described above. Now, suppose I extract the data from S/4HANA with Signavio Process Intelligence and feed it into this process.

Could I create an agent (if necessary, of course) to check all my DMNs and compare them with the values in the extracted event log?

Or would I have to do it "manually"? That is, link each activity to a DMN (can I link more than one DMN to the same activity in Process Manager?) and create widgets to compare these values?

It would be very valuable if I could have some way to check (an agent perhaps?) all the rules and compare them with the activities mapped in the extracted process.

Any suggestions?

entry.title: ¿Cómo impacta la noticia de adquisición de SmartRecruiters en el ecosistema de SAP SuccessFactors?
entry.content:
SAP acaba de anunciar la adquisición de SmartRecruiters, la plataforma de talent acquisition basada en IA y utilizada por más de 4.000 empresas en 120 países 🚀

¿Por qué es importante y llama tanto la atención este anuncio? aquí te lo explico en simple 👇🏼:

1) Suite end-to-end: Con SmartRecruiters, SAP SuccessFactors cubrirá ahora todo el ciclo de vida del talento en una sola experiencia, desde la atracción y el reclutamiento hasta la incorporación, el desarrollo y la retención ✅

2) IA y automatización del reclutamiento: Matching basado en datos, chatbots para candidatos y analítica de funnel de contratación llegan nativos... Queda menos margen para el viejísimo “lo contraté por intuición” 🤭

3) Experiencia + marca empleadora: SmartRecruiters es conocida por su enfoque “candidate-centric”: procesos móviles, one-click apply y comunicación transparente. Ingredientes clave para competir por talento en un mercado de vacantes tech que sigue en alza 📈

4) Ventaja para los clientes actuales de SuccessFactors : Se integrará con la arquitectura Joule / BusinessAI, así que los jobs, skills y datos de desempeño fluirán sin bloqueos… y sin infinitos conectores de terceros 👌🏽

La guerra por el talento no se gana con más manuales de onboarding, sino con experiencias coherentes desde la primera búsqueda en LinkedIn hasta la primera evaluación de desempeño... Esta jugada de SAP demuestra que el mercado se mueve de “mejores procesos” a experiencias inteligentes de principio a fin 👏🏽

Si ya usas SuccessFactors , ¿qué funcionalidad de SmartRecruiters te gustaría integrar primero?

¡Los leo y felicitaciones SAP por este gran paso!

entry.title: Can Joule AI Make SAP Readiness Check & Process Insights Smarter?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m Tommy, an intern at SAP. As part of my internship, I’ve been given the research topic:

                  "How to utilise Joule to interpret SAP tools such as Readiness Check and Signavio Process Insights"

After discussions with the original topic proposer, I’ve refined this to:

                    "Leveraging Joule AI for immediate, context-aware interpretation of SAP tools such as Readiness Check and Process                                  Insights outputs through integrated or standalone models."

Current ideas under exploration:

Potential role of AI (Joule):

                     Integrated approach – Joule embedded directly in tools for live Q&A and guidance.

                     Standalone approach – Central Joule portal where exported tool data is uploaded for AI-generated summaries.

Industry & process-specific insights:

                     Could Joule be trained using Signavio Process Explorer as a knowledge source?

Customer-specific process learning:

                     Could Joule learn a customer’s business processes over time to adjust tool benchmark thresholds?

                     For example, if a process is flagged as problematic by a benchmark but is actually fine for a specific customer, could                                 Joule adapt to avoid false alarms?

I’m not looking to start a conversation and see if this direction aligns with others’ perspectives and see if anyone has experience in the topic.

Would love to hear your thoughts!

Are there any specific prerequisites or configurations unique to NS2 setups that would impact the scope of these AI features?
Any insights or guidance on this compatibility and feature parity would be greatly, Thank you

entry.title: SAP Joule Introduction and its applications in SAP FICO
entry.content:
What Is SAP Joule?

SAP Joule is SAP’s AI copilot embedded across its cloud applications. It offers four interaction types—Transactional, Navigational, Informational, and Analytical—that let users perform business tasks via natural language within SAP environments. It understands user context, roles, permissions, and remains secure by design. It can also ground responses in your own business documents.

 How SAP Joule works in Public vs. Private Cloud is one of the most important considerations for finance teams (especially in FICO) deciding on adoption.

Here’s a structured view:

🔹 SAP Joule in Public vs. Private Cloud

  1. Deployment & Integration
  • Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
    • Joule is natively embedded and updated by SAP automatically.
    • Integration with SAP FICO apps (GL, AP, AR, Asset Accounting, Controlling) is out of the box.
    • No additional installation required - users just activate and configure.
  • Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)
    • Joule can be enabled, but may require additional setup and integration.
    • Some Joule features might lag behind public cloud, because public gets innovations first.
    • Still integrates with FICO, but might require extra configuration & tenant connections to SAP BTP.
  1. Feature Availability
  • Public Cloud
    • Joule supports all 4 interaction types (Transactional, Navigational, Informational, Analytical) directly in Fiori apps.
    • Example in FICO: “Post vendor invoice” → transaction executes directly.
    • Faster delivery of Joule Agents and Joule Studio.
  • Private Cloud
    • Informational & Analytical features available early (queries, reports, insights).
    • Transactional flows may require enablement through custom skills/agents.
    • Joule Studio can still be connected via SAP BTP, but adoption speed depends on customer’s upgrade cycle.
  1. Customization & Extensibility
  • Public Cloud
    • Limited custom coding—extensions must go through SAP BTP side-by-side development.
    • Joule skills/agents are mostly standardized.
    • Great if you want speed & standardization.
  • Private Cloud
    • More flexibility: you can create custom FICO processes, reports, and Joule agents.
    • Easier to integrate with on-prem or legacy systems.
    • Suited for companies with complex finance processes.
  1. Data Security & Residency
  • Public Cloud
    • Data is hosted on SAP-managed hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP, SAP DCs).
    • Joule queries financial data via secure APIs; customers rely on SAP’s compliance.
  • Private Cloud
    • You control hosting, location, and more of the security stack.
    • Some finance-heavy industries (banking, defense, public sector) may prefer this for regulatory reasons.
  1. Upgrade & Innovation
  • Public Cloud
    • Quarterly upgrades → Joule features arrive first and fastest.
    • Example: New Joule Agents for FICO tasks (like dispute resolution) appear immediately.
  • Private Cloud
    • Annual upgrades (with optional Feature Packs).
    • Joule features arrive later—innovation follows public cloud by a few cycles.

📊 Comparison Table

Aspect

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Availability

Native, out-of-the-box

Needs setup, later adoption

Updates

Quarterly, fastest innovations

Annual/controlled upgrades

Customization

Limited, BTP-based

Flexible, deep customizations

Security

SAP-managed hyperscalers

Customer-controlled

FICO Use Cases

Immediate transactional & analytical support

Strong for complex, regulated finance scenarios

Joule Studio

Fully available

Available via BTP, more flexible

✅ Which is Better for FICO?

  • Public Cloud → Best if you want rapid innovation, standard finance processes, faster AI adoption.
  • Private Cloud → Best if you need deep customization, strict compliance, hybrid IT integration.

 SAP Joule version requirements for S/4HANA Cloud editions (Public and Private):

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Joule arrived as part of the Public Cloud starting around Q3 2024, and is embedded in all releases thereafter, including 2408 (August 2024) and onward.
  • While Joule is built into these releases, you still need proper entitlement and authorization to use it; this may require activation via your SAP admin or account executive.
  • There are setup guides available detailing how to activate Joule once entitlement is granted.

In Summary:

If your system is on Public Cloud release 2408 (Aug 2024) or later, Joule is already supported—assuming you've got the right access and permissions.

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Joule is available in the Private Cloud as well, but requires setup and configuration. It's not automatically active—you must enable it via SAP BTP and Joule Studio.
  • Technical prerequisites include ensuring the UI5 version in your system meets or exceeds the minimum required for Joule integration. The specific UI5 version will depend on your release; you can consult SAP documentation for exact details.

In Summary:

Private Cloud systems can support Joule—but you must set it up, ensure the UI5 stack is compatible, and configure the feature via BTP.

  1. SAP S/4HANA On-Premise (Classic)
  • Joule is not supported on on-premise S/4HANA. SAP has confirmed it's not on the current roadmap for classic on-premise systems.
  • There’s a planned strategy—possibly coming Q1 2025—to enable Joule via SAP Build Work Zone, BTP, and Joule Studio even for on-prem systems. But as of now, Joule remains unavailable on-prem and unsupported.

High-Level Overview

Edition

Supported from (release)

Requirements

Public Cloud

2408 (Aug 2024) onward

Needs entitlement/authorization & activation

Private Cloud

Post-2024 releases

Requires UI5 prerequisites + BTP/Joule Studio setup

On-Premise (classic)

Not supported (as of now)

No Joule availability; roadmap may include future BTP-based solution

Summary:

  • Public Cloud: Joule is supported starting with 2408 onward—activate it via entitlement.
  • Private Cloud: Joule is available but not automatic—requires UI compliance + setup via BTP.
  • On-Premise: Joule is not supported yet; no built-in version availability.

Here’s how SAP Joule, SAP’s generative AI assistant, can be applied specifically within the SAP FICO (Finance & Controlling) domain:

SAP Joule Application in FICO

  1. Transactional Interactions

Joule allows users to perform CRUD operations and manage financial documents via natural language—imagine asking:

  • “Post a vendor invoice of $5,000 to account X with due date Y.”
  • “Show me the status of PO invoice 10234.”
    While SAP hasn't yet released out-of-the-box FICO conversational flows, Joule’s transactional model supports this kind of interaction across cloud applications.
  1. Navigational Interactions

Instead of navigating through menus to reach Fiori apps like “Display GL Account Balances,” you could simply ask:

  • “Where can I review G/L balances?”
    Joule will direct you to the relevant screen.
  1. Informational Interactions

Straight answers instead of digging through help docs. You can ask:

  • “What’s the difference between cost center and profit center accounting?”
  • “Explain account determination for automatic postings.”
    Joule will deliver concise explanations, referencing SAP documentation or your own policy documents.
  1. Analytical Interactions

Joule bridges your natural-language queries to data analytics:

  • “Show me quarterly expense trends per cost center.”
  • “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
    It returns charts, metrics, or dashboards—leveraging SAP Analytics Cloud integration.

Advanced: Joule Agents & Studio

Joule Agents

SAP has introduced AI agents—autonomous actors capable of executing complex, multi-step workflows across business functions. In FICO, custom agents could:

  • Automate dispute resolution: Collaborate across finance and service teams to validate discrepancies and propose corrections.
  • Cash collection workflows: Analyze overdue invoices, coordinate with collections, and initiate follow-ups.
    These agents are part of SAP’s cross-functional automation strategy.

Joule Studio (within SAP Build)

No-code/low-code tool to create custom skills or agents tailored for your FICO needs:

  • Build a skill to automatically generate internal financial reports, or trigger approval workflows.
  • Automate vendor reconciliation or recurring postings by designing tailored AI agents.
    These skills and agents integrate across SAP and non-SAP systems.

Summary Table

Joule Capability

FICO Use Case Example

Transactional

Post invoices, check payment status via natural language

Navigational

Ask “Where to view Cost Center Reports?”

Informational

Clarify financial terms or posting rules

Analytical

Generate trends and KPI charts using SAC

Agents & Studio

Automate dispute resolution, cash collection, approvals

Key Benefits in FICO

  • Boost Productivity: Save time by speaking instead of clicking through screens.
  • Reduce Errors: Leverage conversational clarity and auto-generated documents.
  • Improve Insights: Conduct data reviews and root cause analysis through simple dialogue.
  • Automate Complex Workflows: Agents handle multi-step tasks such as reconciliations or approvals automatically.

Real-World Usage Context -- Caveats

While SAP is rapidly developing Joule’s capabilities, many implementations remain in pilot or PoC stages. Users in forums report limited early usage, primarily for basic navigation or queries.

 

Here are concrete FICO scenarios where you could pilot SAP Joule and even extend it with Joule Agents / Studio:

🔹 Pilot Scenarios in SAP FICO

  1. Invoice & Payment Handling
  • Ask Joule:
    “Post an invoice for vendor ABC with $12,000 due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Action: Creates the posting, validates tax code, and confirms with you.
  • Extension with Agent: Automate follow-up—if payment not cleared by due date, Joule Agent triggers a reminder email or escalates.
  1. Month-End Close Assistant
  • Ask Joule:
    “What are the pending tasks for month-end close?”
  • Joule Action: Lists open items (accruals, GR/IR clearing, reconciliations).
  • Extension with Agent: Automate recurring accrual postings and send alerts to approvers who are late in providing confirmations.
  1. Financial Analysis & Insights
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me expense trend per cost center for last 6 months.”
  • Joule Action: Returns a chart (via SAC integration).
  • Extension with Agent: Forecast next quarter’s expenses and flag cost centers that may exceed budgets.
  1. Audit & Compliance Checks
  • Ask Joule:
    “List journal entries above $50,000 in the last quarter without approvals.”
  • Joule Action: Generates a filtered list.
  • Extension with Agent: Create an automated internal audit agent that periodically checks for compliance exceptions and notifies controllers.
  1. Treasury & Cash Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “What is today’s cash position?”
  • Joule Action: Summarizes bank balances, incoming/outgoing payments.
  • Extension with Agent: Auto-generate a daily treasury dashboard at 9 AM and send to CFO.
  1. Dispute & Collections Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me customers with invoices overdue > 60 days.”
  • Joule Action: Lists overdue accounts.
  • Extension with Agent: An AI agent sends personalized payment reminders and schedules calls with collections staff.
  1. Budget vs. Actual Control
  • Ask Joule:
    “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
  • Joule Action: Shows variances with drill-down.
  • Extension with Agent: Automatically notify budget owners when variances exceed a threshold (say 10%).

🔹 How to Design in Joule Studio

In Joule Studio (within SAP Build) you can:

  1. Create a Skill → “Generate quarterly P&L by company code and send PDF to finance team.”
  2. Create an Agent → “Monitor overdue vendor payments and auto-initiate dunning.”
  3. Connect Non-SAP Apps → e.g., send approvals via MS Teams or Slack.

👉 This way, Joule moves from a copilot (answering queries) to a colleague (executing finance tasks for you).

 

Deep Dive on one of the real-world example: Vendor Invoice Posting with SAP Joule in Public vs Private Cloud.

🧾 Example: Vendor Invoice Posting with Joule

🔹 Scenario

A finance user wants to post a vendor invoice for Vendor 300012, amount $12,000, due in 30 days.

1️⃣ Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    👉 “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    1. Understands the intent (“Create Vendor Invoice”).
    2. Pulls relevant master data (Vendor 300012 details, tax code, payment terms).
    3. Pre-fills the invoice screen in Fiori.
    4. User confirms → Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Public Cloud:
    • Joule can immediately display the document number and due date schedule.
    • If connected to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Joule can also show how this impacts cash outflow forecast.
    • Minimal setup → available out-of-the-box.

2️⃣ Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    👉 “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    1. Joule recognizes intent, but instead of direct posting, it may:
      • Provide navigation → “Open FB60 (Vendor Invoice Entry)” or “Fiori App: Create Supplier Invoice.”
      • Pre-fill metadata only if integrated with custom Joule Skill via Joule Studio.
    2. User manually confirms or adjusts in the classic posting screen (e.g., FB60 / MIRO).
    3. Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Private Cloud:
    • You can customize Joule Agent (via Joule Studio + BTP) to enforce company-specific validations (e.g., block invoices >$10,000 without 2 approvals).
    • Joule can connect to legacy non-SAP apps (like OCR invoice scanners or in-house workflow systems).
    • Requires more setup & governance compared to Public Cloud.

📊 Side-by-Side Comparison

Step

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Activation

Native, plug-and-play

Needs setup & integration

Invoice Posting

Joule executes directly in Fiori app

Joule suggests navigation, may require custom agent for automation

Data Validation

Standard rules auto-applied

Flexible, can embed custom compliance rules

User Effort

Minimal (voice/text → posted)

Moderate (confirmation in screen, extra steps if no custom agent)

Analytics

Immediate cash flow impact via SAC

Possible, but may need manual SAC integration

Customization

Limited (SAP-standard process)

Flexible (custom workflows, approvals, legacy integration)

✅ Takeaway:

  • In Public Cloud, Joule = speed + simplicity → perfect for companies with standard finance processes.
  • In Private Cloud, Joule = control + flexibility → better if you need extra compliance steps, custom posting logic, or hybrid integration.

Joule SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics SAP S/4HANA Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Service SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Sales

entry.title: End to End Activation Guide for S/4HANA public Cloud and SAP Business AI - Joule
entry.content:
SAP Business AI - Joule in S/4HANA public Cloud

    End-to-End activation guide for SAP S/4 HANA and SAP AI-Copilot

 

  1. Introduction:

SAP Business AI is SAP’s integrated approach to bringing artificial intelligence directly into business processes, applications, and user experiences.

Its core strength is contextual intelligence—leveraging master and transactional data while respecting each user’s role and authorizations.

There are two Main pillars in SAP AI Strategy.

  • Custom AI Solutions via SAP BTP AI Services – e.g., SAP AI Core, Launchpad services.
  • Business AI – native AI capabilities embedded across SAP’s applications.

 

 

  1. In a previous blog, I covered building custom AI in BTP . “#Vectorize your data for Infuse AI in to Business using Hana Vector and Generative AI”.
  2. This post focuses on the second pillar—Starting from a clean SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant activation and enabling Business AI - Joule (AI copilot) setup.

2 On-Boarding process of SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition for TDD:

This section covers entitlement ordering, system provisioning, tenant activation, identity services setup, and post-onboarding configurations for the Test, Demo & Development (TDD) edition.

2.1 Order the CBC, IAS/IPS & S4 Tenants :

Log in to SAP Partner Portal with your S-user. [ https://partneredge.sap.com/].

Request TDD license; admin receives welcome emails with CBC, IAS/IPS & S/4 tenant URLs and admin credentials.

2.2 Provisioning  the Technical System:

System provisioning can be done  via 'SAP for Me’.

The sequence of system provisioning should be CBC , CIS Sync up[IAS/IPS], SAP S/4 HANA Dev and Customizing Tenant.

2.3 CBC Set up:

  1. Configure Scope and Organisational Structure in CBC.
  2. Create an Evaluation Project (not Implementation).
  3. Assign required CBC roles.
  4. Select demo data during initial project setup.
  5. Ensure deployment targets point to your S/4HANA Public Cloud URL.

 

           

2.4 Additional CBC Set UP and guidelines:

  • Find CBC URL: CIS → Applications → XSUAA → CBC → Home URL.
  • Replicate CBC groups to CIS via IPS resync job.
  • Assign correct CBC roles in IAS and maintain correct user IDs to avoid login issues.
  • Validate target system properties in CBC admin console.

 

2.5 User Setup in CIS & S/4:

Once all the set ups are done , you can see the below FLP looks like this.

You can use the identity access MGMT tile to onboard the new users , roles and groups.

By default, the Super Admin is assigned the SAP_BR_Administrator role along with other standard SAP roles in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud application.

The best practice is to Create the custom roles from the template and assign to the user instead of assign the standard role.

To onboard a new user you can follow the below steps in CIS and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud.

3. Enabling Business AI Copilot (Joule) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

This purpose of this guide is to provide step-by-step instructions on how to set up a Joule that can work in SAP SAP S/4 HANA public Cloud Edition.

3.1 Validate the Joule service assignment.

 In BTP Entitlements, ensure Joule is assigned.

Add missing service plans and Save

        

 

3.2 Validate SAP BTP Build Work Zone- Standard Edition.

  • Add Work Zone in entitlements if missing.
  • Ensure Joule and Work Zone are in the same global account, subaccount, and region where Joule is available.
  •  you need to carefully choose the right data center where Joule is available and nearest to your location.

       

3.3 Validate the System Registration in BTP : [Auto-Discovered / Manual]

In the SAP BTP cockpit, you can have the overview of all your systems associated with your customer ID. These systems can be registered or auto discovered.

Make sure that your SAP S/4 HANA DEV and Customizing Tenants ,  CIS Tenant  and CBC Tenants which you are configured earlier are exists here . If not you need to add it manually in the BTP Global Account à System Landscape Systems link.

 

3.4 Get the token for your system from BTP and Register it in S/4HANA Cloud Tenant

Choose your SAP S/4 HANA public cloud Tenant in the system Landscape-->Systems--> Choose All Communication Scenarios --> Get Token

Capture the registration token and keep  and login in to SAP S/4 HANA cloud .

Register this token in Maintain extension link and Click on Approve  button as YES.

 

Once this is completed , Refresh the system landscape button , and you can see your SAP S/4 HANA cloud system status shown as registered in green color.

3.5 Set up the subaccount , Spaces and Cloud Foundry.

As part of your sub account creation , make sure that you are going to choose the right region where joule data centers are available.

Once sub account has been created , create the Cloud Foundry and Space.

3.6 Set up the Entitlement in the subaccount.

Go to your subaccount à Entitlements--> Add service Plan -->Search Joule and work zone and add those services.

  • Setup Trust Configuration

From the Navigation Pane on the left, select Trust Configuration. Click Establish Trust.

From the CIS  tenants, choose the one that is also used by your applications and click Next.
Note: The tenant chosen here must be the same as the one used by SAP S/4 HANA Cloud application for which Joule is configured.

3.7 Trust the Domain in BTP.

Need to  add the Trusted Domains. To do this, click on the Settings options in the Subaccount and click on Add under Trusted Domain.

   

3.8 Trust the Domain in SAP Cloud Identity Services

Click on CISà Applications and Resources -> select Tenant Settings -> and then click on Customization -> click on the Trusted Domains option -> add your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition URLs

3.9 Create the service key for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

This  Service Key which will be used during the destination creations and for SAP CIS – Identity Provisioning Services (source & target) role mapping to your Work Zone.

 

Assign the required roles as well for the users.

3.10 Run the Joule Booster in the BTP Global account

BTP Global Account--> click Boosters >> search for Joule >> click Start on Setting up Joule tile.

 

 

Finally you will get the success message like this.

3.11 Post Booster Validation.

The formation created here is a logical grouping of SAP systems. Once the formation is created, you can include an SAP solution system in it and change it anytime.

 

 

3.12 Create Navigation Service Destination

We need the destination services for Joule to work with your LoB applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. To create this, SAP BTP Subaccount, --> Connectivity option --> Destination --> Create New Destination.

 

You have to use the Service Key for the Joule.

This contains client id , secret  Token URL..etc.

3.13 SAP S/4HANA Destinations setup in BTP Subaccount 

Navigate in to BTP Sub Account  --> Click Connectivity -> Destinations and confirm the destinations required for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition are successfully created in your BTP Subaccount. The following 5 destinations should already exist in your BTP S4HANA_PUB_SSO

  • SAP S/4HANA SSO
  • Joule Design time Destination
  • Joule Run time Destination
  • Runtime Default
  • Runtime Datas

Already you have created the “navigation service” manually.

3.14 Validate the Communication Arrangements:

Navigate in to  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition System -->  launch the Communication Arrangements Tile.

Confirm that Communication Arrangements with Scenario ID SAP_COM_0647 and SAP_COM_0882 are automatically added by the Joule booster.

 

 Make sure SAP_COM_0647 exposure role collection is set to ALL.

 

The navigate in to Communication Systems Tile.

You can 4 new systems are created. The System ID and System Names will have cryptic values.

3.15 Create the Inbound Communication System:

Navigate to Communication system à Create the new one-->Specify the host name and port and create the communication user Id and proposed  password.

For the communication arrangement choose SAP_COM_0193  and save it.

3.16 Create Communication Use for the communication System step

Create the  Communication User . Navigate to --> Maintain Communication Users -> Click on New and enter the details 

Capture this user id and password will be used in Source system creation step.            

3.17 Manage Content Security Policy

Navigate to SAP S/4 HANA Cloud--> Manage Content Security Policy à Trusted Sites--> Managed By--> UI_RESOURCES_SCRIPTS --> Managed by Customer tab--> Add the URL of the Joule.

This Joule URL you can get it from the BTP cockpit – Joule Service.           

3.18 Configure the IDP for SSO set up between Source and the Target System.

Here the

  • Source system is SAP S/4HANA Public cloud
  • Target system is SAP BTP Build zone standard edition.

You have option to create the system manually or upload the template of Source and Target System.

Find the attachment of the ZIP file.  From this template you can easily create the source and target files.

 

Go to CIS console -->  IDP --> Source System --> Click Add --.> Browse and Upload the Source File.

Update the properties as per screen shot.

Here you need to update the User and Password captured from the STEP 15 [Communication user creation step in S/4 HANA]

 

Target System Creation:

Upload Target JSON file by click on ADD button in the IDP-->Target system.

Proceed the update the details and properties.

Source System -  Earlier you created.

cflp.providerId :   ID of the S/4 content provider created in Work Zone.

URL : portal-service url from the from the  Work Zone instance in BTP.

OAuth2TokenServiceURL :  URL from the Work Zone instance in BTP should be ends woth oauth/token.

User: clientid 

Password: clientsecret 

3.19 Provision Users and Groups from S/4HANA Cloud to Work Zone

Navigate in to Identity Provisioning >> Source Systems--> Choose the system you created --> Job--> Read Job--> Click Run Now button.

In the provisioning Logs , verify the log status.

You can find the status of the user and groups  in Work Zone channel manager by click on refresh button.

3.20 Verify Joule in SAP Fiori Launch Pad / Work Zone.

Enter the URL of the SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud in the browser --> You can notice the DIAMOND icon of  JOULE in the TOP right corner.

Open and enter your queries in the interactive assistant.

4 Conclusion:

In this blog post , I have covered the end-to-end steps for set up the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant in TDD environment and activate the Business AI- Joule.

Following that I provided the detailed steps like Onboarding , Provisioning the system, CBC set up, CIS IAS /IPS set ups , BTP service activation ,  Boosters for the service , System and user set up , Trust and SSO set ups.

entry.title: /cap-gen-app missing in BTP - BAS – was it removed?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I have been using the SAP BTP Trial account and the Build Code environment. Back in June-July, I was able to use the /cap-gen-app and /cap-app-logic commands and creating CAP Models in Joule without any issue.

However, now in in the Business Application Studio I can only see the following commands only:

  • /fiori-gen-cap-ui

  • /fiori-gen-spec-app

  • /hana-gen

  • /hana-modeling-help

  • /hana-sql-gen

  • /sap-help

The /cap-gen-app and /cap-app-logic commands are no longer available Joule.

Could you please clarify if:

  • this commands has been removed from the BTP Trial offering, or

  • if I need to activate it differently (e.g., via Dev Space settings or Extensions)?

It would be great to know if this is a permanent change or just a temporary limitation of the Trial environment.

Thanks a lot in advance!

Best regards,
Gabor
